name: 2-pyridinecarboxamide, 3-hydroxy-
Reason: 2-Pyridinecarboxamide, 3-hydroxy- has a basic unit of pyridinecarboxamide, which has a melting point around 190°C. The presence of a hydroxy group can increase the melting point due to hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions, which can raise it by approximately +10°C. However, the hydroxy group also introduces a more polar and asymmetric structure, which can reduce the crystal lattice stability, potentially decreasing the melting point by approximately -10°C. Summing up these changes: Pyridinecarboxamide base (+190°C), hydroxy group (+10°C), and hydroxy group (-10°C).
